title: Exxon Mobil as COP26 play? Here's why Morgan Stanley says some of the dirtiest companies will benefit from decarbonization.
text:
Wall Street aims to build on records after October rally

U.S. stock futures rise Monday, setting the stage for further records ahead of a pivotal Federal Reserve decision later in the week. See full story.

How much is Big Pharma making from COVID-19 vaccines? We're about to find out

U.S. pharmaceutical companies are expected to collect more revenue from COVID-19 vaccines in the third quarter than they did in the entire first half of the year, and that money should continue to grow. See full story.

Arby's new sandwich goes toe-to-toe with a cult classic: McDonald's McRib

Arby's latest offering is a country-style rib sandwich that promises smoky authenticity. Does it deliver? See full story.

‘I'd rather be a billionaire and not be loved by everybody': Charlie Munger shrugs off controversy over $200M donation for nearly windowless dorm

An architect resigned in protest over plans for Munger Hall at University of California, Santa Barbara. See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

'Some Black people wonder why you love that “white sport,” and some people don't want you around because of your Blackness,' says Evan Moore, co-author of 'Game Misconduct: Hockey's Toxic Culture and How to Fix It.' See full story.
